title: Govt. to initiate steps for offshore petroleum exploration
byline: The government is to undertake offshore gas exploration after the selection of a consultant firm to handle the international tender process in this regard, an official said yesterday.

title: Upcoming festive season drives economic activities across manufacturing and services
byline: The upcoming festive season gave an additional boost to the already expanding activities across the economy, as both manufacturing and services activities continued to grow through February.

title: Four killed in elephant attacks across 3 districts in March: DMC reports
byline: While issuing an island-wide incident summary, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) today reported that four persons from the Moneragala, Anuradhapura and Hambantota districts were killed in elephant attacks between March 10 and 13.

title: 14 Sri Lankans rescued from cybercrime centers in Myanmar
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, in coordination with Sri Lanka’s Embassies in Myanmar and Thailand, and with support from the Governments of Myanmar and Thailand, has facilitated the rescue of 14 Sri Lankans who were trafficked and forcibly employed in cybercrime centers in Myawaddy, Myanmar.

title: A 16-hour water cut in Katana
byline: The Katana residents are set to experience a 16-hour water cut today as the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced that water supply to several areas in the city will be suspended.

title: Hard Rock Cafe to make Sri Lankan debut at Colombo City Centre by 2025
byline: US restaurant chain Hard Rock Cafe has sealed a deal with Abans and will be entering Sri Lanka, marking its debut in the island nation.

title: Paddy, tea and coconut production drops, fuelling inflation concerns
byline: Sri Lanka’s agricultural sector is facing a significant downturn, with key crops such as paddy, tea and coconut experiencing sharp declines in production.

title: SriLankan Airlines could generate US $ 1bn in 3 months with strategic overhaul: Ex-CAA chief
byline: SriLankan Airlines could generate US $ 1 billion in revenue within three months, if the right leadership and policies are in place, said former Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) Chairman Upul Dharmadasa.

title: Court issues warrant on third witness in Mrs. World Pageant incident
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Tanuja Lakmali, today issued a warrant on Asha Basnayake, the third witness in the case related to the alleged forcible removal of the crown from Pushpika De Silva, the winner of the Mrs. World pageant held at Nelum Pokuna Theatre in Colombo in 2021.

title: NASA to Provide Live Coverage of Crew-9 Return, Splashdown
byline: NASA will provide live coverage of the agency’s SpaceX Crew-9 return to Earth from the International Space Station, beginning with Dragon spacecraft hatch closure preparations at 10:45 p.m. EDT Monday, March 17.

title: Milk powder prices to increase by 4.7% from April 1
byline: Importers of milk powder have decided to increase the prices of milk powder products by 4.7%, effective April 1.

title: Chamara Sampath urges Speaker to take action against COPE member who had referred to him as ’Badulle Bada’
byline: Opposition MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake today urged the Speaker to take action against a COPE member who had referred to him as ’Badulle Bada’ during a recent meeting of the committee.

title: Sinister move by some trade unions to take patients in state hospitals as hostages: Health Minister
byline: There is a sinister move by some trade unions to call for a strike action taking patients in state hospitals as hostages, Minister of Health Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa told Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka's apparels, rubber, plastic goods export could be affected by Trump's trade policy: Deputy Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s apparel, rubber, coconut and plastics exports could be affected by US President Donald Trump’s trade policy which is expected to be effective from April this year, Deputy Minister Anil Jayantha told Parliament today.

title: Israel launches ’extensive strikes’ on Gaza with at least 220 reportedly killed
byline: The Israeli military says it is carrying out ’’extensive strikes’’ in the Gaza Strip, with the Hamas-run health ministry reporting that at least 220 Palestinians have been killed.

title: BYD unveils battery system that charges EVs in 5 minutes
byline: BYD has unveiled a new system for electric cars that the Chinese carmaker says will allow them to be charged almost as fast as it takes a regular car to refuel.

title: Customs seize Rs. 120 million worth of smuggled cigarettes at Colombo Port
byline: A consignment of illegally imported cigarettes worth over Rs. 120 million was recovered by the Customs Revenue Task Force (RTF) during an inspection at a warehouse within the Colombo Port premises.

title: Tattoos not allowed for police recruitment
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have released a video featuring a senior officer explaining the requirements for joining the police force.

title: Mattala Airport struggles as it turns 12
byline: Sri Lanka’s Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) marks its 12th anniversary today but the underutilised facility continues to struggle with financial losses and minimal airline traffic, renewing calls for a strategic overhaul.

title: Adani Group still keen on renewable power project in Sri Lanka
byline: The Adani Group is still keen to get Adani Green Energy’s $1-billion renewable energy power project in Sri Lanka back on its agenda, sources said. In February, the company had said it had decided to withdraw from the project, but it has maintained a foot in the door, as both sides are likely to come to an agreement on the tariffs to be charged, sources with knowledge of the ongoing developments said.

title: Hard Rock Cafe to make Sri Lankan debut at Colombo City Centre by 2H25
byline: US restaurant chain Hard Rock Cafe has sealed a deal with Abans and will be entering Sri Lanka, marking its debut in the island nation.

title: Hatton Police officer remanded over bribery allegation
byline: A police officer from Hatton arrested for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 20,000 to release a complainant and his wife from legal proceedings, has been remanded till April 1 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali today.

title: FR petitions against Adani Mannar wind power project withdrawn
byline: Five Fundamental Rights petitions, which were filed seeking an order to prevent the authorities from issuing any permits to Adani Green Energy Sri Lanka Limited for operating a wind power plant in Mannar, were withdrawn today before the Supreme Court.

title: President meets Police Chiefs in Western Province
byline: Steps will be taken to provide the necessary facilities to eliminate organized crimes and drug abuse, as well as to introduce new legislation, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Govt. assures to rectify delays in releasing imported vehicles from Customs
byline: The Finance Ministry and other relevant institutions will intervene immediately to rectify the delays in releasing newly imported vehicles from the Sri Lanka Customs, Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Government expects Speaker to take action against MP Ramanathan Archchuna: Nalinda
byline: Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today the government expects that the Speaker will take some action against Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna.

title: Woman dead after elephant pulls down walls
byline: A woman who was asleep in her home was pinned under  the debris of the walls pulled down by a rogue elephant that had entered her home garden in the early hours of last morning. She was rushed to hospital but died on admission.

title: Cold Shoulder for be Sri Lankan Camp
byline: US basketball legends inspire a new era for Sri Lankan basketball

title: Lankadeepa’ wins most popular people’s newspaper award for 19th consecutive year
byline: Our sister paper Lankadeepa newspaper won the Most Popular People’s Newspaper of the Year Award for the 19th consecutive year at the ’SLIM-KANTAR People’s Awards 2025’ being held at the Monarch Imperial, Sri Jayawardenapura Kotte.

title: How did CR’s title defence fall like house of cards?
byline: Kandy Sports Club dominated the Inter-Club League Rugby Tournament to secure the title during the weekend emerging as the unbeaten champions setting up a stunning farewell for their outgoing star Nigel Ratwatte.

title: Heavy rainfall of 75mm expected in some areas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has warned that some areas in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as the Galle and Matara districts may receive rainfall exceeding 75mm tomorrow (19).

title: Curfew imposed in India city after large-scale violence
byline: A curfew has been imposed in parts of a city in India’s western state of Maharashtra after Hindu groups demanded the removal of the tomb of Aurangzeb, a 17th-Century Mughal emperor, sparking violence on Monday night.

title: Deshabandu received monthly salary from SLC: Opposition MP
byline: While alleging that IGP Deshabandu Thennekoon has received a monthly salary of Rs. 150,000 from Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) in addition to free fuel during the past years, Opposition MP Hesha Withanage urged the government to conduct a probe into it.

title: Sri Lanka cricket captains challenge player employment classification
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket ODI Captain Charith Asalanka and Test Cricket Captain Dhanajaya De Silva have filed writ petitions before the Court of Appeal challenging the classification of Sri Lanka’s national cricketers as employees of the national association, Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) by the Inland Revenue Department (IRD).

title: Imthiaz Bakeer Markar resigns as SJB Chairman
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Chairman Imthiaz Bakeer Markar has resigned from his post.
